meanings.definition: To give or assign value to something.
meanings.sent1: I always try to valorize my old belongings by taking good care of them.
meanings.sent2: It is important to valorize education as a key to success.
meanings.sent3: The little girl decided to valorize her teddy bear by giving it a special crown.
meanings.sent4: In her eyes, the worn-out book was valorized as a treasure trove of knowledge.
meanings.sent5: He found a way to valorize even the simplest of tasks, turning them into valuable lessons.

meanings.definition: To praise or exalt someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The coach always makes sure to valorize his players after a good game.
meanings.sent2: It is important to valorize hard work and dedication in the workplace.
meanings.sent3: The comedian couldn't help but valorize his own jokes, making everyone laugh even harder.
meanings.sent4: Her smile valorized the beauty of the whole room, making it shine brighter.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting valorized the ordinary scene, turning it into a masterpiece.
